subject: Re: [junit] Planning Unit Tests
msgSnippet: On Thu, 2003-04-03 at 16:14, artisanzero wrote:  It may
messageBody:
On Thu, 2003-04-03 at 16:14, artisanzero wrote:
<a snippet of how to give an estimate of time to create unit tests
across the lifespan of a project>

It may sound deceptive, but to me it sounds like they have a number in
mind that they simply want you to validate, so validate it knowing that
it makes no sense. Then go ahead and write the tests as needed. I
faced an issue similar to this on a 1.5 year project -- only we were
told that unit tests were simply not a priority, period. We, the
developers, knew we couldn't get along without them, so when the project
plan was given to us without time alloted for automated tests (of any
sort) we simply agreed to it and moved on. We wrote the tests anyway
and delivered ahead of schedule for every milestone/release (with the
exception of one milestone when two of the four processors on our server
went nuts). :p

As I said this may sound deceptive, but at least in our situation it was
the case that the management was not actually opposed to testing, they
were opposed to the thought that it would slow us down. It made for a
rather lively discussion at the end of the project. :p

=jason
